column4: Ontology Name: MoneyOntologyClasses:1. Currency:   This class has different subclasses representing various national currencies such as USD, EUR, GBP etc.2. Coins:   A class encompassing physical money in the form of small, rounded, generally metallic objects.3. Banknotes:   A class representing physical money made from paper or polymer and is generally of higher denominations than coins.4. Electronic Money:   This class represents digital delegation of money that involves online transaction. It includes credit cards, e-wallets, online banking etc.5. Cryptocurrency:   A subclass of Electronic Money which is a secure form of digital currency, the most popular ones being Bitcoin, Ethereum etc.6. ExchangeRate:   Class representing exchange rate of one currency to another.7. Transaction:   Instances of this class would represent money transaction from one entity to another involving either physical or electronic money.8. Entity:   This high-level class would encompass individuals (Person) and organizations (Organization) which are involved in handling and transactions of money.Properties:1. hasCurrencyCode (from Currency to xsd:string):   Represents the standardized currency code.2. hasDenomination (from Coins and Banknotes to xsd:integer):   Represents the denomination value of the physical form of money - coins and banknotes.3. hasValue (from Electronic Money to xsd:float):   Represents the current monetary value of Electronic Money.4. hasExchangeRate (from Currency to ExchangeRate):   Links a currency to its corresponding exchange rate data.5. hasCurrency (from Entity to Currency):   Represents which type of currency an entity deals with.6. executedTransaction (from Entity to Transaction):   Represents the transaction carried out by the entity.7. involvesCurrency (from Transaction to Currency):   Shows which currency was used in a particular transaction.8. hasCryptographicKey (from Cryptocurrency to xsd:string):   Represents the cryptographic public-private key pair associated with the cryptocurrency.9. hasTransactionAmount (from Transaction to xsd:float):   Represents the amount of money transferred in a transaction. 10. associatedWith (from Transaction to Entity):    Signifies the different entities associated with any given financial transaction, be it as givers, receivers or intermediaries.11. hasIssuer (from Currency, Coins, Banknotes to Entity):    Represents the entity that issues a particular form of money.12. hasCryptocurrencyWallet (from Cryptocurrency to xsd:string):    Represents the digital wallet address where the cryptocurrency is stored.Each class will also have 'hasLabel' and 'hasComment' annotation properties which will contain readable names and description of the respective classes and properties.
